revised_title: Satellite Observations of Sea-Surface Temperature for Climate Research
tldr: This article discusses the importance of measuring global sea-surface temperature from space with high accuracy for climate research. It reviews current satellite measurements of sea-surface temperature using infrared and microwave techniques and describes the future sea-surface temperature-measuring instrument, the Along-Track Scanning Radiometer (ATSR). The article highlights the need for accurate empirical determinations based on direct measurements to establish a better understanding of the Earth's climate.
